title: Specify build directory for a package marked for development
body:
If I

```console
spack develop -p $SRC_DIR baz@main +foo
spack concretize -f
spack install
```

The build artifacts will be put directly in `$SRC_DIR`.  Eg,

```console
$ ls $SRC_DIR/spack-*
spack-build-env.txt    spack-build-fvndqrb/
spack-build-out.txt    spack-configure-args.txt
```

If I later 

```console
spack install baz@main ~foo
spack develop -p $SRC_DIR baz@main ~foo
spack concretize -f
spack install baz@main ~foo
```

It will overwrite the various `spack-build-*` files for the `+foo` variant.

A build root argument to `spack develop` would alleviate this issue:

```console
spack develop -h
...
-b BUILD_ROOT, --build-root BUILD_ROOT
        Where to build package
```

The following would be the desired result:

```console
$ spack install baz@main ~foo
$ spack install baz@main +foo
$ spack develop -p $SRC_DIR -b /var/tmp/baz_foo baz@main +foo
$ spack develop -p $SRC_DIR -b /var/tmp/baz_nofoo baz@main ~foo
$ spack concretize -f
$ spack install baz@main ~foo
$ spack install baz@main +foo
$ ls /var/tmp/baz_foo/spack-*
spack-build-env.txt    spack-build-fvndqrb/
spack-build-out.txt    spack-configure-args.txt
$ ls /var/tmp/baz_nofoo/spack-*
spack-build-env.txt    spack-build-xzqe4rn/
spack-build-out.txt    spack-configure-args.txt
```
